findings.title: The dealIfNotLock function visibility error
findings.description: In the _dealIfNotLock_ function, anyone can call it to use the funds in the contract to exchange or add liquidity. When the contract has accumulated a certain amount of funds, the hacker can use the flash loan to control the price of the token in the pair, and then call This function uses the contract to receive orders and make a profit.

findings.title: Fee-free bypass
findings.description: When adding or removing liquidity, there will be no handling fee, because adding or removing liquidity is judged by comparing the actual balance of token in the pair with the reserve. If the attacker wants to buy Atoken, he can remove the liquidity operation to realize the fee-free operation.

findings.title: The funds in the pair pool will be withdrawn
Inconsistent quantity destroyed
findings.description: When the user destroys the token, because the deduction of the handling fee is done first, it will lead to the update of the AMOUNT value, then when the destruction logic is executed, the corresponding number of token will not be destroyed correctly, because the AMOUNT value entered is deducted from the handling fee.
